abstract.p: Shares in Credit Commercial de France fall almost 15 percent after HSBC Holdings, the London-based banking group that acquired control of Credit Commercial in April, says it will acquire 1.4 percent of Credit Commercial shares it does not own for 150 euros ($135) a share; Credit Commercial says net profit rose 30 percent in first half of year, to 296.4 million euros ($266.7 million); graph (S)

block.p: Shares in Credit Commercial de France fell almost 15 percent after HSBC Holdings, the London-based banking group that acquired control of Credit Commercial in April, said it would acquire the 1.4 percent of Credit Commercial shares it did not yet own for 150 euros ($135) a share. Credit Commercial said its net profit rose 30 percent in the first half, to 296.4 million euros ($266.7 million). Yet the news of HSBC's bid, intended to withdraw Credit Commercial shares from the bourse, caused the share price to drop 14.9 percent, to 151.1 euros.

Shares in Credit Commercial de France fell almost 15 percent after HSBC Holdings, the London-based banking group that acquired control of Credit Commercial in April, said it would acquire the 1.4 percent of Credit Commercial shares it did not yet own for 150 euros ($135) a share. Credit Commercial said its net profit rose 30 percent in the first half, to 296.4 million euros ($266.7 million). Yet the news of HSBC's bid, intended to withdraw Credit Commercial shares from the bourse, caused the share price to drop 14.9 percent, to 151.1 euros.
